page.title: 18Public Services
page.content: GLASCOED FILTER STATION continued All the filters at the station have recently been converted to a dual media operation. A considerable improvement in output has been achieved by this modification and with the new filter the plant should be capable of filtering about 4 million gallons per day. The water after treatment is stored in Clear Water reservoir tanks before being distributed to St. Asaph, Abergele and Prestatyn. All the Water Treatment Plant is underground except for the Filter House. All the area is well looked after, grass bankings, lawns and gardens are tended by the workmen employed at the plant. They are divided into Filter men and outside maintenance men who work on the rivers, reservoirs, boreholes etc. that feed the treatment plant.
